comments: This class was very hard, but It prepared me for my entire college career. You will read at least 20 pages in between classes and have a quiz every class. It\'s hard, but Pollock truly cares about his students, and he will help you along the way. Tough class, but best prof I\'ve had at WSU, no doubt. He made a required class into one of my favorites.

comments: hardest class I\'ve ever taken, considering I do not like to read. I was miserable. Only take his class if you are interested in history and love reading 30 pages a night with 15 focus questions.

comments: There will be a 10 point quiz at the beginning of every class. He allows you to retake the quiz at the end of class. There will be tons of reading. I study for this class way more than any other class. Too much work for a general education class in my opinion.

comments: Pollock is tough. Just because he is not a cakewalk like most general education classes are doesn\'t mean he is a bad teacher. Ya you read a lot, but its good for you in the long run. If you read and just try your hardest you will be fine. Also, he cares very much about his students. To this day I haven\'t seen a prof like that besides him

comments: He is amazing! I was working 50-60 hours a week barely making it to class and when I did I was tired and unprepared and he was EXTREMELLY kind and helpful. He explains everything in such detail you have to try not to understand him. He is Always willing to help students and will MAKE time for you. Honestly the reason I stayed in school. Amazing

comments: This class is very hard and was a rude awakening to college. Expect to devote a lot of time to this class and read basically the whole book by the end. You must do all the focus questions and read before every class or you wont pass the daily quizzes. Writing assignments in class each day. If you have the choice take with a different teacher.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  Participation matters (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Caring (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Dr. Pollock has been a pretty good instructor. His class is somewhat challenging, so I would advise you read the required passages before coming to class, or you will NOT pass his quizzes. Other than that, he is very organized and is good at explaining different topics. The only problem I have with his class is that things sort of jump around.

comments: Dr. Pollock is one of the most intelligent professors that i have had at Wright State. He\'s a nice (cute) guy, but you better be ready to work because your going to have to dedicate most of your time to his class.

comments: Dr. Pollock is the most intelligent professor I\'ve ever had, although his class is tough. He expects a lot out of his students, specifically in the form of reading. His quizzes every week are tough, but they are great preparation for the final and midterm. I would suggest that all students to all the readings and focus questions!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  Participation matters (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Caring (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: I LOVED Dr. Pollock! I had him for Honors History: West & World since 1500. He is extremely strict and you definitely have to work hard to keep a good grade in his class. However, he is always willing to answer any questions you have and will go over material with you after class if you need it. Amazing professor!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  Participation matters (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Caring (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: DR. Pollock is GREAT!!! I took his class in spring 2013, and he was inspiring. Yes, you must read a lot, and be prepared for class! He was very helpful with teaching me Chicago style. I still converse with him regularly. He is always willing to help students with questions, and assignments. Great guy!

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  Participation matters (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Caring (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: I spend about 4-7 hours on the reading and study questions every other day. It would be nice if SOMEHOW the daily quizzes related to that material. But no, they don\'t. Yesterday I answered 4 questions that weren\'t even listed in the assignment, let alone the study guide. This happens on a daily basis.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  Participation matters (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Caring (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Dr. Pollock was and is a great professor. His class was fun and enjoyable. There is A LOT of reading, and writing for the class, but Dr. Pollock makes every attempt to help his students understand the material He helps his students with example of how to write, and by giving revision techniques. Great Prof. Definitely recommended!

comments: He was very rude, but intelligent.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  Participation matters (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Caring (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Professor Pollock was one of the best teachers I have ever had. He does expect a lot from you so be ready for some heavy reading and several essays. Overall though he cares greatly about his students and wants to help them succeed just make sure you have extra time to devote to the class.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  Participation matters (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Caring (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Dr. Pollock was one of the best professors I have ever had. His expectations are clear and it makes good use of the class time. Although some of the material was dull, he made it interesting and relatable. He takes an interest in each student and was extremely helpful by working one on one with the us on our papers. He\'s also smoking hot.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  Participation matters (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Caring (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: Dr. Pollock was seriously the best teacher I ever had. The work load is extremely heavy whereas I took the Honors section of his class. Although a lot of work, I have never learned more in any other class. His class helped me decide what I wanted to do the rest of my life.

tag_professor: Get ready to read (9)  Skip class? You won\'t pass. (6)  Participation matters (4)  Tough Grader (3)  Caring (3)  SO MANY PAPERS (2)  Gives good feedback (2)  Clear grading criteria (1)  LOTS OF HOMEWORK (1)
comments: He is an amazing professor. If you love History, love learning, and are willing to work on assignments for HOURS every week then take this class. If this is not your major or you do not have time to devote 7 or more hours of reading (this does not include the essays or ID\'s and I am a very quick reader) then do not take this class!
